intro: Coccocypselum apurense, commonly known as the Apurean coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are typically palmate with five lobes. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in understory layers of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
